What‚Äôs remarkable is that this shift towards slightly more moderate controls coincides with spiraling COVID cases across China. It‚Äôs the first time a wave like this has not resulted in tighter controls, a tacit admission by Beijing that COVID is now beyond controllable.

Today definitely feels like an inflection point in China‚Äôs COVID journey. By no means a total course correction, but a big baby step towards eventual easing. The focus is now clearly more on the ‚Äúdynamic‚Äù part of ‚Äúdynamic zero COVID‚Äù, and less on the ‚Äúzero‚Äù.
